titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John S. Thorne papers 1977.126
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:41:57 +0000.

did.abstract: This collection includes various papers of Dr. John S. Thorne spanning the period 1824 to 1836, including correspondence, notes, commissions and appointments, and admission tickets to classes and lectures at the University of the State of New York College of Physicians and Surgeons and the New York Eye Infirmary.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); John S. Thorne papers, 1977.126, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Letters, 1931.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Dr. John S. Thorne was a Brooklyn resident who studied medicine at the University of the State of New York College of Physicians and Surgeons and then practiced in Brooklyn. He served on the Brooklyn Board of Health and at the Brooklyn Dispensary. Thorne's daughter, Elizabeth, married Samuel Haslett, who was the son of Dr. John Haslett, another prominent Brooklyn physician.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes various papers of Dr. John S. Thorne spanning the period 1824 to 1836, including correspondence, notes, commissions and appointments, and admission tickets to classes and lectures at the University of the State of New York College of Physicians and Surgeons and the New York Eye Infirmary.
